years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for less than a year
pros: Priorities seem straight. Smart and hardworking people who are valued. There seems to be opportunity to grow along with the company because it is growing so much. Work-life balance has positively surprised me - definite sense of understanding that people have lives and interests outside of work, ability to use travel days and leave at normal hours without being shamed. Opportunities to get to know coworkers in social settings outside of the office too. Feels entrepreneurial by nature, employees are encouraged to be self-starters and always be looking for ways to improve Akuna and themselves. Leadership is great, very open-minded people who look for ways to help people grow and develop. Leadership is passionate about Akuna: constantly looking for ways to help Akuna continue to grow and become an industry leader. It seems like a place people stay at for a long time, or if they leave, they return.
cons: Not the most diverse workplace, in need of more women specifically, but understand that this is a priority for Akuna.

years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than a year
pros: good money smart colleagues good social scene
cons: extraordinarily stressful environment even compared to traditionally high-stress cultures such as investment banking and management consulting money partially hoarded by senior management. moreso than you may expect poor tech leadership frequent turnover of employees. quitting/firings are common

review_title: Zero understanding of technology and zero vision.
years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than a year
pros: Events, trips, kitchen, barista
cons:
Lack of any experience of technology in senior management. CEO reads a random technology article believes he is an expert and demands it be implemented. Refuses to listen to actual experts with over a decade of knowledge that the company has hired.

Unwillingness to fix legacy technology issues due to cost which leads to constant issues throughout the environment. Turnover rate in IT makes it impossible to improve upon years of barely keeping the lights on.

review_title: From First to Worst and Clueless how to Fix It
years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than 3 years
pros: They did great with technology and making hay while the HFT sun shined. Shared the wealth, made everyone happy.
cons: Absolutely clueless about how to move to being quantitatively-oriented or economically-aware. I've recommended people with PhDs and experience leading teams... and they made every one of them take an insulting arithmetic and python coding test. That was all kinds of awkward explaining to very accomplished people why we put them through a one-size-fits-all process that is fighting improving the place. In the end, all that did was sully the firms name with some influential people. FML for trying. Of course, this is why I don't intend to stay here much longer: I can see the writing on the wall.

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Work life balance can be good, at least sometimes. Office location is great. Free drinks, company trips. Compensation can be good when market favors.
cons:
If you are a graduate, and intersted in market making, this can be a good firm for you to learn. Technologies used are very limited, not fantastic. After some years, you can decide if you're really interested in this area and probably you still can find another job in the market (although the skills may be not that marketable).

Some senior folks are not that friendly and makes you feel terrible. For example, may be talking something completely wrong without knowing it. And they stop you to challenge it. How would you feel if your 'manager' is like a kid that doesn't know the programming basics? Besides this, insulting words and personal attacks are something you may feel during work.

review_title: Clueless and management with poor compensation structure
years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Literally none at the moment
cons: When there is a good year management reduces bonuses for everybody but pays themselves big fat checks, and when there is a bad year bonus is not performance related at all. The whole company has no clue where to invest (senior tech management is fired all the time, 4 CTOs in 2 years), and the quant team has a changed direction every 5 minutes. The whole trader management has no understanding of technology and no respect for quantitative measures.

review_title: Turning sour fast, morale at all time low
years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than 3 years
pros: My turn soon over here. Had a few good years, the right place right time, with a decent kitchen.
cons: 2018 on record year bonuses were almost flat so management could pay themselves higher. 2019 year was chaos. Profits down dramatically. Greedy mismanagement, no clear direction. Entire firm is just copy + paste of Optiver strategies, which can only take you so far. No new ideas just iterating on the late 2000s. CEO spend half the year distracted by a fumbled deal, then fire the CTO and cause exodus of senior developers (after some of the best senior traders and quants already left). Management generally absent, across the board low understanding of modern technology - probably not a single person in trader management could explain you how to write basic script, yet they try to call the shots for tech directions! Read positive reviews on the glassdoor with salt - many very obvious stink of HR flavors.

review_title: Great company but expect long hours
years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time
pros: Very nice perks, Great atmosphere Amazing people Very smart people and always will to cooperate
cons: Work/life balance doesn’t exist You have to give up on some of your weekends for sure

years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than a year

cons: Too much reaction and not enough planning with everything they do in IT. Job stability is not good. No 401K match. Some people had ego’s and thought cakes and pies made everything nice.

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for less than a year

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than a year

years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time

years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL for less than a year
pros: They put a lot of time in training you. They're all very intelligent and motivated. It's a laid back culture, so long as you perform. Regular 9-5 hours with great pay.

review_title: Bleeding edge tech. Everyone makes a difference.
years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL
pros: * Reasonable, down-to-earth management * Top tech talent * People are serious about their work * Many social opportunities * Very cool office * Freedom to explore new technologies, propose ideas * Immediate feedback (move fast and break things) * Great work schedule * Ping pong culture, breakfast, snacks
cons: * Very fast-paced, not for the faint of heart * High pressure/responsibility - money is on the line every second of the day * Growing very quickly, expect to devote a chunk of time to the interview process * Training programs are improving, but you are still definitely expected to hit the ground running * Some benefits are still being ironed out

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than a year
pros: The individuals hired by Akuna are truly the best in their field. Everyone is highly intelligent and motivated to go above and beyond, but also are fun loving people who you would want to grab a beer with! The desire to be the best is felt at every level of Akuna and it makes work truly enjoyable.
cons: We have a lot of goals we want to accomplish so work can be hectic at times, but your efforts are always rewarded and recognized by senior level management. There is no catered lunch like other prop firms, but they actually want you to get up from your desk and get some fresh air so the motivation behind it is good.

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL
pros: related to finance major and in a big city
cons: so many rounds of interview

employee_status: Trade Support Engineer in Chicago, IL
years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL for less than a year
pros: Cutting edge technology Always something to do Pay and benefits are superb Kitchen is always stocked with food
cons: Expect to work 12+ hours a day

years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL
pros: 1. The people - fair warning: my response to this is corny. During my stay at Akuna, I met some of the most intelligent people I've ever met in my life. Not only that, but I made some great friendships that'll I'll cherish for a long time to come. 2. Atmosphere - they still had the same startup vibes as when I started, with plenty of ping pong, and company events to enjoy once work was finished. Put your full effort into your work, and get it done; you will be rewarded. After trading hours, work is very chill. Additionally, the new office is super nice. 3. Company size - Akuna is still a fairly small company, so your hard work will rarely go unnoticed. They're at a sweet spot where you can still move up fairly quick, but they still have a lot of nice benefits (i.e nearly unlimited snacks in the kitchen, and nice paychecks).
cons: The cons I saw in Akuna are pretty industry standard: high turnover, tough workload to get acclimated to, and some other small things.

years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL
pros: Great teaching and the people are really invested in your learning. Great culture and amazing people
cons: There weren't any bad things about the internship. It was a great internship in a great location with a great company

years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL
pros: relaxed, good salary, good team environment and collaborative
cons: i wish i could have kept up

years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL
pros: Interns are given full charge of a project that spans over the whole internship. You are responsible for the project from design to release. But when you reach out for help, you are almost definitely going to get the help you need. People just know their stuff so well, which is quite impressive.
cons: Sometimes, the interaction among employees is not effective as it looks like. Some employees are not given much attention.

years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL
pros: Encouraging and helpful staff that were eager to help me learn
cons: Expected to know a lot coming in

years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL
pros: Lot's of independence. Hard working environment. Sociable people. No wasted hours at work, and recreational lounge/ping pong table. Extremely performance oriented.
cons: Can be cliquey. Need 5 words at least..

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL
pros: The office is really nice and the people are great
cons: They just expanded so the office is pretty empty

review_title: Constantly shifting priorities, no respect for the tech workforce
years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than a year
pros: You get to learn a lot about different technologies, you're always busy (never bored), and they're very interested in cutting edge tech
cons: Priorities change often, sometimes daily, but the timelines don't change with them. Expectations from upper management are "aggressive". 60 hour work weeks are the norm, but don't spend 5 minutes reading the news while eating lunch at your desk or they will notice and remember it. Pay is inline with the rest of the prop trading world, but not amazing. They have a tendency to screw people on their bonus (dismiss late in the year or pay out only a small portion of their target). At least for the support staff, and the partners don't like hearing "no" as an answer. Partners have snarky nicknames for most of the staff. Management is very clique-y and if you're not an Aussie or Brit you won't fit in.

years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than 3 years
pros: High end tech and some brilliant individuals you have the opportunity of working with. Great place to cut your teeth and learn. Great mentoring early early on.
cons: That's where it stops. Bonuses are very low for the industry if you make it through pre bonus firings to actually collect. The partners are there to either pay themselves back wholly first or reinvest in expansion or growth (good in theory) but at the expense of abysmal bonuses for good performance and the promise of "when we hit it big you'll get it!" Not. The start-up feel of a team is used as leverage to motivate everyone under the illusion of what's good for the goose is good for the gander. This couldn't be further from the truth unless you're Aussie. Aussie is the new Dutch here ironically for a group fleeing Optiver from similar ethnic favoritism. Be very careful of any feelings of loyalty.

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time
pros: Great environment to learn, most of the senior traders are happy to give you their time. Fantastic new office space and tons of social events outside of work hours
cons: Biggest gripes were with the old office, loving the new space

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time
pros: New office and process are bringing Akuna into a new era of stability and success. Continued growth and training are paying off in this fast paced competitive industry.
cons: Very competitive, if you don't have what it takes to grow in your career and provide the value to Akuna they're expecting, you won't make the cut for very long. If you do, however, you'll rise through the ranks and contribute a lot while being compensated for it.

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Still got that start-up vibe even though been around a few years now. Really smart people in all departments with a great work ethic and culture. Everyone works hard, and it's expected of you, but that's ok as it seems to be paying off and the work is enjoyable and cutting edge. Traders are for the most part good people to work with, and they understand the technology. Lots of investment in the business and a huge focus on the technology which seems to be paying off. They're growing fast but it's measured, not expanding too fast. A good mix of experienced people and a lot of juniors, some fresh out of school, some with a few years experience. Big emphasis on campus recruitment where they have seen some smart people rise very quickly.
cons: Sometimes seems a bit chaotic but thats just the startup vibe I think, lots of things going on! A bit hard to know what the future plans are for the company as its kept close to the managements chest

years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL for more than a year
pros: Cutting edge technology, well organized.
cons: High employee turnover, siloed projects, inexperienced crowd, clannish management.

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time
pros: You will be given responsibility early. Technology is developing fast and there is good investment in this side. If you demonstrate that you deserve it you will get the chance to make a difference to the firm. Good culture, good people.
cons: tough on non-performers (might be a pro). split office space not great though I hear there is a new office next year sometime

review_title: A great, growing trading startup with lots of upside.
years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than a year
pros: Profit sharing - if you perform and the company performs you get paid accordingly in your bonus. Career progression - the company is growing so lots of opportunity to work on different projects and relatively junior employees get the chance to show their skills. Innovation - Akuna has lots of very smart employees and it is very intellectually rewarding to work with and learn from them.
cons: As to be expected in a new company some systems and processes are less established. This means that the employees with initiative and who are self-directed tend to thrive.

years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL
pros: They salary are good as an intern, and they are a young team with a lot of young traders and developers. They environment is good as well.
cons: The company fires people really frequently, last year they fired several junior level traders and half of the developers in Champaign office.

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL
pros: - A vibrant and fascinating place to work - The learning curve is incredibly steep however they train you in a way that gives you every opportunity to succeed if you come armed with the right attitude - The organization is generally a flat structure and traders, quants and developers aptitudes and skillets are recognized early in the process and are given ample time to develop - A great motivator of this job is working with incredibly intelligent and driven colleagues who are all pushing to make Akuna a thriving success, which it is already is in its short existence
cons: As with any company growing as fast as Akuna is, there are obvious growing pains which the organization have to overcome such as available office space and meeting rooms (bring back the ping pong table!! it is dearly missed!!) As the company is relatively young in terms of its competitors, outside sources sometimes believe we are not as tech-savvy and tech-focused as others. This is quite the contrary though as vast resources are allocated to making our proprietary systems the best in the business

years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time
pros: Some good people, in a culturally significant area which makes going to lunch nice, in a spacious office. Good experience with high frequency trading.
cons: Long hours, tons of pressure, workspace is average, no free lunch or snacks, no free drinks (CEO does not believe in tipping), arrogance. Nepotism: CEO & CFO are married.CEO, COO, Head of Trading, and CEO are best friends. Be careful if you have an opinion that disagrees with them, they will not like it and you will not rise in the company. Terrible work/life balance: there are constant "initiatives" that you have to complete yesterday so the compnay can succeed. When we deliver, and profit the leadership does not share the gains. No or low bonuses. CEO micro manages everything. He is leading developer scrums and telling HR how to do their job better. The CEO also plays favortism with certain ethnic groups. If you are Australian you are well liked, otherwise you are on the outside of the decision making loop. Arrogant and inexperienced are the key words here. Also I would like to mention that the CEO walks around in his bare feet all the time which is super classy. That being said, you may have to endure a "workout" meeting where he does pull ups while you try to convey important information about the firm between a set.

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL for more than a year
pros: Good, hard-working group of guys
cons: Very few, solid company in general

review_title: No decent company but ok for junior
years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than a year
pros: Spend a lot of money on expansion. I felt happy for the first 3 months and learnt a lot of useful things on options and market making.
cons: No very technical and quantitative driven firm. Focus too much on expansion but less on how to keep people.Compensation is not good at all compared to its Chicago peers. You can see old people leave and new people in from time to time. High turn over.

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL
pros: Great pay and bonuses, smart people to work with, growing quickly, lots of opportunity, entrepreneurial environment, all whilst still being a laid back culture that is very enjoyable to work within.
cons: Even though the company does let some people go (as you can see by some of the other reviews) the company still carries a lot of dead weight.

years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than a year
pros: Great Industry. Fast-paced. Company still growing.
cons: Where to begin. There is no real HR department, and the company structure in general is extremely unclear. The company was a sweatshop. Long hours and no benefit nor compensation for people who decide to work more. People who are actually doing the work aren't being recognized. Its kinda like you're either in or you're looking in from the outside.

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than a year
pros: A great place to work, wonderful atmosphere and good bosses. The company has grown really quickly and there seems to be much more growth in the years ahead. You are expected to work hard, however the culture and atmosphere somehow manage to be fun and relaxed. Friday night drinks every week certainly help this. The career opportunities and room for growth seem huge, I've seen people around me gain responsibilities so quickly. Overall a pretty great place to work.
cons: If you don't work hard and contribute it'll really show with such dedicated coworkers. You can't slack off and be lazy because the management won't accept that for long from an employee. It's really a place for those who want to push themselves and be pushed to excel.

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time
pros: very nice person and startup company
cons: i don't have any idea

review_title: Exciting times at a fast-growing company
years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than a year
pros: Really smart people, working on exciting things. Growing fast and big plans for the future. Fun atmosphere in the office, you get to work closely with the managers from the start.
cons: Pretty high pressure; lots to deliver so it's not a place for people looking for a relaxing job

review_title: Best up and coming trading company in Chicago
years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time
pros: Very fast paced and challenging job every day. New employees get lots of responsibility very quickly. There are lots of opportunities as it is a young company growing very quickly. Great work environment with lots of company events and a flat structure.
cons: Technology team is not able to keep up with the trading team. Within the trading team it is not quite as competitive as I was expecting or hoping for. Currently it is very reliant on some desks and employees.

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for less than a year
pros: Fast paced with a lot of opportunities. Seems to be one of the few companies in this space growing and there is an excellent vibe in the office. You get onto the trading desk quickly with a good training program. Chance to interact with lots of smart people who are working hard. Good social events.
cons: Things move quickly and there seem to be a lot of balls in the air. Could be unsettling if you are not cut out for that.

review_title: Work somewhere you can be proud of, not here.
years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than a year
pros: Learning experience. Nice desks. There is fruit. Big monitors. Nice seats. I am trying to meet a 20 word minimum..
cons: Bad employee relationship building. Bad benefits. Expect favoritism Employee's voice/needs are ignored. Discriminating environment. Your degree gets more attention than you ever will. Management is extremely questionable. Their number 1 concern is their 'image'. They have a long way to go and are stubborn when change is requested/presented.

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than a year
pros: Akuna has an experienced senior team to learn from. You are given a lot of responsibility early in your career, as opposed to trading at a bank where you may not actually trade for a couple of years. Fun environment including a company trip every year.
cons: It's getting a little harder to get one on one time with senior people as the company has grown.

years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time
pros: Some people within the company are great to work with!
cons: Some people are not great to work with. Some traders within a niche group get more chances than others.

review_title: Decent company in a souring industry
years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time
pros: High pay for juniors, lots to learn, smart people (ex-Optiver), a firm that is still making money, cool bosses (as long as you don't go overboard)
cons: You don't really get more than one warning. People get let go very easily or leave, but I'm not sure if it's just Akuna or simply the industry right now. Afterall, it is the partners' money they're paying you. Industry isn't doing well, and the firm is not very technology driven.

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time

cons: Political atmosphere if you are not within the "Circle" or an Aussie.

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than a year

review_title: New kids on the block taking over!

years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL
pros: New company. Room to grow.

review_title: Need some experience on board for firm's expansion
years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than a year
pros: Some good people, friendly Decent pay Know the US options markets
cons: Expansion into Asian markets (then apparently UK/EU markets ) lacks anyone in managment/operations who is experienced with this process. The firm has essentially been US focussed for 8 years. Asia/UK/EU different infrastructure/cost/culture/rules UK/EU is especially a regulatory minefield but no-one in managment/operations has a clue about this. Huge recruitment drive going on ... similar to Tibra a few years ago which ended in diasaster and massive round of redundancies. Needs tailored expansion.

review_title: Quite hard work, but good environment for learning.

Canteen

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for more than a year
pros: Great teams and work culture! I feel supported and comfortable sharing my ideas. Team leads have provided me with the training I need to take ownership of my role quickly, and I have a clear pathway for my career progression. I am very lucky to be a member of Team Akuna!
cons: No cons to mention here.

years_at_company: I have been working at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time for less than a year
pros: Akuna is growing! There's lots of responsibility, accountability and exposure. You have the freedom of getting involved in projects of interest aligned to company goals.

review_title: Waste of time, worse than industry standard
years_at_company: I worked at AKUNA CAPITAL full-time
pros: Akuna has some smart talents that has led to competitive technological advances. The benefit package is mediocre, compare to any industry. The new office is so much nicer.
cons: There were so many people who have absolutely no clue what they are doing, from the lowest level to the highest level. I think many people found the job super boring and left, including myself. There was no upside unless you were in it from the beginning, and the pay was small for rest of us. I found another job that pays me more and have more upside. The HR is also terrible handling how/when/after people decide to leave.
